extension.name: org.apache.nifi.processors.elasticsearch.JsonQueryElasticsearch
extension.description: A processor that allows the user to run a query (with aggregations) written with the ElasticSearch JSON DSL. It does not automatically paginate queries for the user. If an incoming relationship is added to this processor, it will use the flowfile's content for the query. Care should be taken on the size of the query because the entire response from ElasticSearch will be loaded into memory all at once and converted into the resulting flowfiles.

property.name: el-rest-query
property.description: A query in JSON syntax, not Lucene syntax. Ex: {"query":{"match":{"somefield":"somevalue"}}}. If this parameter is not set, the query will be read from the flowfile content.

property.name: el-query-attribute
property.description: If set, the executed query will be set on each result flowfile in the specified attribute.

property.name: el-rest-fetch-index
property.description: The name of the index to use.

property.name: el-rest-type
property.description: The type of this document (used by Elasticsearch for indexing and searching)

property.name: el-rest-client-service
property.description: An ElasticSearch client service to use for running queries.

property.name: el-rest-split-up-hits
property.description: Split up search results into one flowfile per result.

property.name: el-rest-split-up-aggregations
property.description: Split up aggregation results into one flowfile per result.

relationship.name: aggregations
relationship.description: Aggregations are routed to this relationship.

relationship.name: failure
relationship.description: All FlowFiles that cannot be read from Elasticsearch are routed to this relationship

relationship.name: original
relationship.description: All original flowfiles that don't cause an error to occur go to this relationship. This applies even if you select the "split up hits" option to send individual hits to the "hits" relationship.

relationship.name: hits
relationship.description: Search hits are routed to this relationship.

writesAttribute.name: aggregation.name
writesAttribute.description: The name of the aggregation whose results are in the output flowfile

extension.name: org.apache.nifi.processors.elasticsearch.DeleteByQueryElasticsearch
extension.description: Delete from an ElasticSearch index using a query. The query can be loaded from a flowfile body or from the Query parameter.

property.name: el-rest-query
property.description: A query in JSON syntax, not Lucene syntax. Ex: {"query":{"match":{"somefield":"somevalue"}}}. If this parameter is not set, the query will be read from the flowfile content.

property.name: el-query-attribute
property.description: If set, the executed query will be set on each result flowfile in the specified attribute.

property.name: el-rest-fetch-index
property.description: The name of the index to use.

property.name: el-rest-type
property.description: The type of this document (used by Elasticsearch for indexing and searching)

property.name: el-rest-client-service
property.description: An ElasticSearch client service to use for running queries.

relationship.name: success
relationship.description: If the delete by query succeeds, and a flowfile was read, it will be sent to this relationship.

relationship.name: failure
relationship.description: If the delete by query fails, and a flowfile was read, it will be sent to this relationship.

writesAttribute.name: elasticsearch.delete.took
writesAttribute.description: The amount of time that it took to complete the delete operation in ms.

writesAttribute.name: elasticsearch.delete.error
writesAttribute.description: The error message provided by ElasticSearch if there is an error running the delete.
